intro: Cadetia transversiloba, commonly known as the transverseleaf sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy, alternate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Cadetia transversiloba thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
